abstracts.cdata!:
The resettlement principles include
            replacing land for farmers, promoting employment
            opportunities and social assistance to help maintain or
            raise the standard of living, and setting up a grievance
            mechanism to resolve problems. Land replaced will be
            equivalent in both quantity and quality, or alternatively
            cash compensation will be paid according to set criteria
            based on land surveys and consultation with the affected
            populations. The resettlement plan also calls for offering
            technical and service training to raise their capability to
            do seasonal and temporary work, and to pay yearly subsidies
            to farmers. As part of the plan, the procedures covering
            land selection, information disclosure, and village
            consultation for land acquisition are outlined. Resettlement
            planning will be coordinated with local state land
            regulation, the social development plan, and the national economy.
